0.html: Complete reference documentation for the AiMo Network API.
0.text: Complete reference documentation for the AiMo Network API.
0.title: API Reference

1.html:
All API requests should be made to:

https://api.aimo.network/v1
1.text:
All API requests should be made to:
https://api.aimo.network/v1
1.title: Base URL

2.html:
AiMo Network uses API keys for authentication. Include your API key in the Authorization header:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

Get your API key from the AiMo Network Dashboard.
2.text:
AiMo Network uses API keys for authentication. Include your API key in the Authorization header:
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY
Get your API key from the AiMo Network Dashboard.
2.title: Authentication

3.html:
API rate limits vary by subscription tier:

  • Free Tier: 100 requests per minute
  • Pro Tier: 1,000 requests per minute
  • Enterprise: Custom limits

Rate limit headers are included in all responses:

X-RateLimit-Limit: 1000
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 999
X-RateLimit-Reset: 1234567890
3.text:
API rate limits vary by subscription tier:

Free Tier: 100 requests per minute
Pro Tier: 1,000 requests per minute
Enterprise: Custom limits

Rate limit headers are included in all responses:
X-RateLimit-Limit: 1000
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 999
X-RateLimit-Reset: 1234567890
3.title: Rate Limits

6.title: Management APIs

8.html:
Most language models support the OpenAI-compatible chat completion format:

curl -X POST https://api.aimo.network/v1/chat/completions \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "model": "gpt-4",
    "messages": [
      {"role": "user", "content": "Hello, world!"}
    ],
    "max_tokens": 100
  }'
8.title: Chat Completion

9.html:
Generate images from text descriptions:

curl -X POST https://api.aimo.network/v1/images/generations \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "model": "dall-e-3",
    "prompt": "A beautiful sunset over the ocean",
    "size": "1024x1024"
  }'
9.title: Image Generation

10.html:
Create vector embeddings for text:

curl -X POST https://api.aimo.network/v1/embeddings \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "model": "text-embedding-ada-002",
    "input": "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
  }'
10.title: Embeddings

11.html: All API responses follow a consistent format:
11.text: All API responses follow a consistent format:
11.title: Response Format

12.html:
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    // Response data here
  },
  "meta": {
    "request_id": "req_123456789",
    "model": "gpt-4",
    "provider": "openai",
    "latency_ms": 1234
  }
}
12.title: Success Response

13.html:
{
  "success": false,
  "error": {
    "code": "invalid_request",
    "message": "The request was invalid",
    "details": "Missing required parameter: model"
  },
  "meta": {
    "request_id": "req_123456789"
  }
}
13.title: Error Response

14.html:
Common error codes and their meanings:

CodeDescription
invalid_requestThe request was malformed or missing required parameters
authentication_failedInvalid or missing API key
rate_limit_exceededToo many requests - see rate limiting section
model_not_foundThe specified model does not exist
insufficient_creditsAccount has insufficient credits for the request
model_unavailableThe model is temporarily unavailable
internal_errorAn unexpected error occurred on our servers
14.text:
Common error codes and their meanings:
CodeDescriptioninvalid_requestThe request was malformed or missing required parametersauthentication_failedInvalid or missing API keyrate_limit_exceededToo many requests - see rate limiting sectionmodel_not_foundThe specified model does not existinsufficient_creditsAccount has insufficient credits for the requestmodel_unavailableThe model is temporarily unavailableinternal_errorAn unexpected error occurred on our servers
14.title: Error Codes

15.html:
Official SDKs are available for popular programming languages:

  • Python: pip install aimo-network
  • JavaScript/TypeScript: npm install @aimo/sdk
  • Go: go get github.com/aimo-network/go-sdk
  • Rust: cargo add aimo-network

19.html: Welcome to AiMo Network! This guide will help you get started with the platform and make your first API call.
19.text: Welcome to AiMo Network! This guide will help you get started with the platform and make your first API call.
19.title: Getting Started

20.html:
AiMo Network is a decentralized AI model orchestration platform that provides:

  • Unified API access to hundreds of AI models
  • Competitive pricing through marketplace dynamics
  • High availability with automatic failover
  • Enterprise security and compliance
  • Rich analytics and monitoring
20.text:
AiMo Network is a decentralized AI model orchestration platform that provides:

Unified API access to hundreds of AI models
Competitive pricing through marketplace dynamics
High availability with automatic failover
Enterprise security and compliance
Rich analytics and monitoring
20.title: What is AiMo Network?

22.text: Create your free account at aimo.network.
22.title: 1. Sign Up

23.html:
After signing up:

  1. Go to your dashboard
  2. Navigate to API Keys
  3. Click "Create New Key"
  4. Copy your API key (keep it secure!)
23.text:

Go to your dashboard
Navigate to API Keys
Click "Create New Key"
Copy your API key (keep it secure!)

24.html:
Make a quick test request using curl:

curl -X POST https://api.aimo.network/v1/chat/completions \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "model": "gpt-3.5-turbo",
    "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": "Hello, AiMo!"}],
    "max_tokens": 50
  }'

32.html: Learn how to install and configure AiMo Network SDKs and tools.
32.text: Learn how to install and configure AiMo Network SDKs and tools.
32.title: Installation

33.html: AiMo Network is primarily a RESTful API service. No installation is required for basic usage - you can start making HTTP requests immediately with your API key.
33.text: AiMo Network is primarily a RESTful API service. No installation is required for basic usage - you can start making HTTP requests immediately with your API key.
33.title: API Access

35.html:
Install the Python SDK via pip:

pip install aimo-network

Basic usage:

from aimo import AimoClient
 
client = AimoClient(api_key="your_api_key")
response = client.chat.completions.create(
    model="gpt-4",
    messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Hello!"}]
)
print(response.choices[0].message.content)
35.text:
Install the Python SDK via pip:
pip install aimo-network
Basic usage:
from aimo import AimoClient
 
client = AimoClient(api_key="your_api_key")
response = client.chat.completions.create(
    model="gpt-4",
    messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Hello!"}]
)
print(response.choices[0].message.content)
35.title: Python SDK

36.html:
Install via npm:

npm install @aimo/sdk

Basic usage:

import { AimoClient } from '@aimo/sdk';
 
const client = new AimoClient({
  apiKey: process.env.AIMO_API_KEY
});
 
const response = await client.chat.completions.create({
  model: 'gpt-4',
  messages: [{ role: 'user', content: 'Hello!' }]
});
 
console.log(response.choices[0].message.content);
36.title: JavaScript/TypeScript SDK

37.html:
Install the AiMo CLI for command-line access:

npm install -g @aimo/cli

Configure your API key:

aimo auth login
37.text:
Install the AiMo CLI for command-line access:
npm install -g @aimo/cli
Configure your API key:
aimo auth login
37.title: CLI Tool

38.html:
Create a .env file in your project:

AIMO_API_KEY=your_api_key_here
AIMO_BASE_URL=https://api.aimo.network/v1
38.text:
Create a .env file in your project:
AIMO_API_KEY=your_api_key_here
AIMO_BASE_URL=https://api.aimo.network/v1
38.title: Environment Setup

39.html:
Test your installation:

# Using CLI
aimo models list
 
# Using curl
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer $AIMO_API_KEY" \
  https://api.aimo.network/v1/models

41.html: AiMo Network is a decentralized AI model orchestration platform that connects AI model providers with users, creating an efficient marketplace for AI inference services.
41.text: AiMo Network is a decentralized AI model orchestration platform that connects AI model providers with users, creating an efficient marketplace for AI inference services.
41.title: What is AiMo Network?

42.html:
AiMo Network acts as a bridge between:

  • Users who need AI model inference capabilities
  • Providers who host and serve AI models
  • Developers who build applications using AI models
42.text:
AiMo Network acts as a bridge between:

Users who need AI model inference capabilities
Providers who host and serve AI models
Developers who build applications using AI models
42.title: Core Concept

44.html:
• Access to diverse models: Choose from hundreds of AI models from different providers
  • Cost-effective: Competitive pricing through marketplace dynamics
  • Reliable service: Built-in redundancy and automatic failover
  • Simple integration: Unified API for all models
44.text:
Access to diverse models: Choose from hundreds of AI models from different providers
Cost-effective: Competitive pricing through marketplace dynamics
Reliable service: Built-in redundancy and automatic failover
Simple integration: Unified API for all models
44.title: For Users

45.html:
• Monetize your models: Earn rewards by serving inference requests
  • Easy onboarding: Simple model registration process
  • Transparent pricing: Set your own rates and see real-time demand
  • Performance insights: Detailed analytics on model usage
45.text:
Monetize your models: Earn rewards by serving inference requests
Easy onboarding: Simple model registration process
Transparent pricing: Set your own rates and see real-time demand
Performance insights: Detailed analytics on model usage
45.title: For Providers

46.html:
• Unified interface: One API to access hundreds of models
  • High availability: Automatic load balancing and failover
  • Scalable infrastructure: Handle any workload size
  • Developer-friendly: Comprehensive SDKs and documentation
46.text:
Unified interface: One API to access hundreds of models
High availability: Automatic load balancing and failover
Scalable infrastructure: Handle any workload size
Developer-friendly: Comprehensive SDKs and documentation
46.title: For Developers

47.html:
1. Model Discovery: Browse available models by capability, price, and performance
  2. Request Routing: AiMo intelligently routes requests to optimal providers
  3. Inference Execution: Models process requests and return results
  4. Billing & Rewards: Transparent usage-based billing and provider rewards
47.text:
Model Discovery: Browse available models by capability, price, and performance
Request Routing: AiMo intelligently routes requests to optimal providers
Inference Execution: Models process requests and return results
Billing & Rewards: Transparent usage-based billing and provider rewards
47.title: How It Works

51.html: Welcome to the AiMo Network Provider Guide! Learn how to monetize your AI models by joining our decentralized marketplace.
51.text: Welcome to the AiMo Network Provider Guide! Learn how to monetize your AI models by joining our decentralized marketplace.
51.title: Provider Guide

52.html: AiMo Network enables AI model owners and operators to monetize their infrastructure by serving inference requests to users worldwide.
52.text: AiMo Network enables AI model owners and operators to monetize their infrastructure by serving inference requests to users worldwide.
52.title: Become a Provider

53.html:
• Monetize your models: Earn revenue from every inference request
  • Global reach: Access users from around the world
  • Transparent pricing: Set your own rates and see real-time demand
  • Easy integration: Simple APIs for model registration and hosting
  • Performance insights: Detailed analytics on usage and earnings
53.text:
Monetize your models: Earn revenue from every inference request
Global reach: Access users from around the world
Transparent pricing: Set your own rates and see real-time demand
Easy integration: Simple APIs for model registration and hosting
Performance insights: Detailed analytics on usage and earnings
53.title: Why Become a Provider?

55.html:
Before becoming a provider, ensure you have:

  • AI models that you own or have rights to commercialize
  • Hosting infrastructure capable of serving inference requests
  • API endpoints that can handle HTTP requests
  • Monitoring capabilities for performance and availability
55.text:
Before becoming a provider, ensure you have:

AI models that you own or have rights to commercialize
Hosting infrastructure capable of serving inference requests
API endpoints that can handle HTTP requests
Monitoring capabilities for performance and availability
55.title: Requirements

56.html:
1. Application: Submit your provider application
  2. Model review: Our team reviews your models for quality and safety
  3. Integration: Implement our provider API endpoints
  4. Testing: Complete integration testing and performance validation
  5. Go live: Start receiving and fulfilling user requests
56.text:
Application: Submit your provider application
Model review: Our team reviews your models for quality and safety
Integration: Implement our provider API endpoints
Testing: Complete integration testing and performance validation
Go live: Start receiving and fulfilling user requests
56.title: Onboarding Process

83.title: Prerequisites

84.html:
First, obtain your API key from the AiMo Network dashboard:

export AIMO_API_KEY="your_api_key_here"
84.text:
First, obtain your API key from the AiMo Network dashboard:
export AIMO_API_KEY="your_api_key_here"
84.title: 1. Authentication

85.html:
Use curl to make a simple inference request:

curl -X POST https://api.aimo.network/v1/inference \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $AIMO_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "model": "gpt-4",
    "messages": [
      {"role": "user", "content": "Hello, world!"}
    ]
  }'
85.title: 2. Make Your First Request

86.html:
List all available models:

curl -X GET https://api.aimo.network/v1/models \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $AIMO_API_KEY"
86.title: 3. Explore Available Models

88.html: Welcome to the AiMo Network User Guide! This comprehensive guide will help you get the most out of the AiMo Network platform.
88.text: Welcome to the AiMo Network User Guide! This comprehensive guide will help you get the most out of the AiMo Network platform.
88.title: User Guide

89.html:
This guide covers everything you need to know as a user of AiMo Network:

  • How to discover and select the right AI models for your needs
  • Making your first API requests and handling responses
  • Authentication and security best practices
  • Managing billing, usage, and costs
  • Advanced features and optimization techniques

102.html:
To get the most out of AiMo Network:

  1. Start small - Begin with simple requests to understand the API
  2. Monitor usage - Keep track of your costs and usage patterns
  3. Handle errors gracefully - Implement proper error handling and retries
  4. Optimize for performance - Use caching and batching where appropriate
  5. Stay updated - Follow our changelog for new features and improvements

Ready to dive deeper? Choose your next topic from the sidebar navigation!

103.html: Learn how to use AiMo Network with practical examples in different programming languages.
103.text: Learn how to use AiMo Network with practical examples in different programming languages.
103.title: Basic Usage Examples

104.html:
Before running these examples, make sure you have:

  1. An AiMo Network account and API key
  2. Your chosen programming language environment set up
  3. The AiMo SDK installed (optional but recommended)
104.text:
Before running these examples, make sure you have:

An AiMo Network account and API key
Your chosen programming language environment set up
The AiMo SDK installed (optional but recommended)
104.title: Prerequisites

106.html:
Using the Python SDK:

from aimo import AimoClient
 
# Initialize the client
client = AimoClient(api_key="your_api_key_here")
 
# Generate text
response = client.chat.completions.create(
    model="gpt-4",
    messages=[
        {"role": "user", "content": "Write a short poem about AI"}
    ],
    max_tokens=100
)
 
print(response.choices[0].message.content)

Using requests library:

import requests
 
url = "https://api.aimo.network/v1/chat/completions"
headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer your_api_key_here",
    "Content-Type": "application/json"
}
 
data = {
    "model": "gpt-4",
    "messages": [
        {"role": "user", "content": "Write a short poem about AI"}
    ],
    "max_tokens": 100
}
 
response = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=data)
result = response.json()
 
print(result["choices"][0]["message"]["content"])
106.title: Python

107.html:
Using the JavaScript SDK:

import { AimoClient } from '@aimo/sdk';
 
const client = new AimoClient({
  apiKey: process.env.AIMO_API_KEY
});
 
async function generateText() {
  const response = await client.chat.completions.create({
    model: 'gpt-4',
    messages: [
      { role: 'user', content: 'Write a short poem about AI' }
    ],
    max_tokens: 100
  });
 
  console.log(response.choices[0].message.content);
}
 
generateText();

Using fetch:

const response = await fetch('https://api.aimo.network/v1/chat/completions', {
  method: 'POST',
  headers: {
    'Authorization': 'Bearer your_api_key_here',
    'Content-Type': 'application/json'
  },
  body: JSON.stringify({
    model: 'gpt-4',
    messages: [
      { role: 'user', content: 'Write a short poem about AI' }
    ],
    max_tokens: 100
  })
});
 
const result = await response.json();
console.log(result.choices[0].message.content);
107.title: JavaScript/TypeScript

108.html:
curl -X POST https://api.aimo.network/v1/chat/completions \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer your_api_key_here" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "model": "gpt-4",
    "messages": [
      {"role": "user", "content": "Write a short poem about AI"}
    ],
    "max_tokens": 100
  }'
108.title: cURL

110.html:
from aimo import AimoClient
 
client = AimoClient(api_key="your_api_key_here")
 
response = client.images.generate(
    model="dall-e-3",
    prompt="A futuristic cityscape with flying cars",
    size="1024x1024",
    quality="standard",
    n=1
)
 
# Get the image URL
image_url = response.data[0].url
print(f"Generated image: {image_url}")
 
# Download the image
import requests
from PIL import Image
from io import BytesIO
 
img_response = requests.get(image_url)
img = Image.open(BytesIO(img_response.content))
img.save("generated_image.png")

110.title: Python

111.html:
import { AimoClient } from '@aimo/sdk';
 
const client = new AimoClient({
  apiKey: process.env.AIMO_API_KEY
});
 
async function generateImage() {
  const response = await client.images.generate({
    model: 'dall-e-3',
    prompt: 'A futuristic cityscape with flying cars',
    size: '1024x1024',
    quality: 'standard',
    n: 1
  });
 
  const imageUrl = response.data[0].url;
  console.log(`Generated image: ${imageUrl}`);
 
  // Download the image (Node.js)
  const fs = require('fs');
  const https = require('https');
  
  const file = fs.createWriteStream('generated_image.png');
  https.get(imageUrl, (response) => {
    response.pipe(file);
  });
}
 
generateImage();
111.title: JavaScript

113.html:
from aimo import AimoClient
import numpy as np
 
client = AimoClient(api_key="your_api_key_here")
 
# Generate embeddings for similarity search
texts = [
    "The weather is beautiful today",
    "It's sunny and warm outside",
    "I love pizza and pasta",
    "Italian food is delicious"
]
 
embeddings = []
for text in texts:
    response = client.embeddings.create(
        model="text-embedding-ada-002",
        input=text
    )
    embeddings.append(response.data[0].embedding)
 
# Calculate similarity between first two texts
embedding1 = np.array(embeddings[0])
embedding2 = np.array(embeddings[1])
 
similarity = np.dot(embedding1, embedding2) / (
    np.linalg.norm(embedding1) * np.linalg.norm(embedding2)
)
 
print(f"Similarity between texts: {similarity:.3f}")
113.text:
from aimo import AimoClient
import numpy as np
 
client = AimoClient(api_key="your_api_key_here")
 
# Generate embeddings for similarity search
texts = [
    "The weather is beautiful today",
    "It's sunny and warm outside",
    "I love pizza and pasta",
    "Italian food is delicious"
]
 
embeddings = []
for text in texts:
    response = client.embeddings.create(
        model="text-embedding-ada-002",
        input=text
    )
    embeddings.append(response.data[0].embedding)
 
# Calculate similarity between first two texts
embedding1 = np.array(embeddings[0])
embedding2 = np.array(embeddings[1])
 
similarity = np.dot(embedding1, embedding2) / (
    np.linalg.norm(embedding1) * np.linalg.norm(embedding2)
)
 
print(f"Similarity between texts: {similarity:.3f}")
113.title: Python

114.html:
import { AimoClient } from '@aimo/sdk';
 
const client = new AimoClient({
  apiKey: process.env.AIMO_API_KEY
});
 
async function generateEmbeddings() {
  const texts = [
    "The weather is beautiful today",
    "It's sunny and warm outside",
    "I love pizza and pasta",
    "Italian food is delicious"
  ];
 
  const embeddings = [];
  
  for (const text of texts) {
    const response = await client.embeddings.create({
      model: 'text-embedding-ada-002',
      input: text
    });
    embeddings.push(response.data[0].embedding);
  }
 
  // Calculate cosine similarity
  function cosineSimilarity(a, b) {
    const dotProduct = a.reduce((sum, val, i) => sum + val * b[i], 0);
    const magnitudeA = Math.sqrt(a.reduce((sum, val) => sum + val * val, 0));
    const magnitudeB = Math.sqrt(b.reduce((sum, val) => sum + val * val, 0));
    return dotProduct / (magnitudeA * magnitudeB);
  }
 
  const similarity = cosineSimilarity(embeddings[0], embeddings[1]);
  console.log(`Similarity between texts: ${similarity.toFixed(3)}`);
}
 
generateEmbeddings();
114.title: JavaScript

116.html:
from aimo import AimoClient
 
client = AimoClient(api_key="your_api_key_here")
 
response = client.chat.completions.create(
    model="gpt-4",
    messages=[
        {"role": "user", "content": "Tell me a story about a robot"}
    ],
    stream=True
)
 
print("Story: ", end="")
for chunk in response:
    if chunk.choices[0].delta.content:
        print(chunk.choices[0].delta.content, end="", flush=True)
print()  # New line at the end
116.title: Python

117.html:
import { AimoClient } from '@aimo/sdk';
 
const client = new AimoClient({
  apiKey: process.env.AIMO_API_KEY
});
 
async function streamResponse() {
  const stream = await client.chat.completions.create({
    model: 'gpt-4',
    messages: [
      { role: 'user', content: 'Tell me a story about a robot' }
    ],
    stream: true
  });
 
  process.stdout.write('Story: ');
  
  for await (const chunk of stream) {
    if (chunk.choices[0]?.delta?.content) {
      process.stdout.write(chunk.choices[0].delta.content);
    }
  }
  
  console.log(); // New line at the end
}
 
streamResponse();
117.title: JavaScript

119.html:
from aimo import AimoClient, AimoError
 
client = AimoClient(api_key="your_api_key_here")
 
try:
    response = client.chat.completions.create(
        model="gpt-4",
        messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Hello!"}]
    )
    print(response.choices[0].message.content)
    
except AimoError as e:
    if e.status_code == 401:
        print("Authentication failed - check your API key")
    elif e.status_code == 429:
        print("Rate limit exceeded - please wait before retrying")
    elif e.status_code >= 500:
        print("Server error - please try again later")
    else:
        print(f"Request failed: {e}")
119.title: Python

120.html:
import { AimoClient, AimoError } from '@aimo/sdk';
 
const client = new AimoClient({
  apiKey: process.env.AIMO_API_KEY
});
 
try {
  const response = await client.chat.completions.create({
    model: 'gpt-4',
    messages: [{ role: 'user', content: 'Hello!' }]
  });
  
  console.log(response.choices[0].message.content);
  
} catch (error) {
  if (error instanceof AimoError) {
    if (error.status === 401) {
      console.log('Authentication failed - check your API key');
    } else if (error.status === 429) {
      console.log('Rate limit exceeded - please wait before retrying');
    } else if (error.status >= 500) {
      console.log('Server error - please try again later');
    } else {
      console.log(`Request failed: ${error.message}`);
    }
  } else {
    console.log(`Unexpected error: ${error}`);
  }
}
120.title: JavaScript
